name: qpxExpress
title: QPX Express API
description: Finds the least expensive flights between an origin and a destination.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

schemas.name: TripOptionsRequest
schemas.desc: A QPX Express search request, which will yield one or more solutions.

fields.name: ticketingCountry
fields.desc: IATA country code representing the point of ticketing.

fields.name: maxPrice
fields.desc: Do not return solutions that cost more than this price. The alphabetical part of the price is in ISO 4217. The format, in regex, is [A-Z]{3}\d+(\.\d+)? Example: $102.07

fields.name: passengers
fields.desc: Counts for each passenger type in the request.

fields.name: refundable
fields.desc: Return only solutions with refundable fares.

fields.name: saleCountry
fields.desc: IATA country code representing the point of sale. This determines the "equivalent amount paid" currency for the ticket.

fields.name: slice
fields.desc: The slices that make up the itinerary of this trip. A slice represents a traveler's intent, the portion of a low-fare search corresponding to a traveler's request to get between two points. One-way journeys are generally expressed using one slice, round-trips using two. An example of a one slice trip with three segments might be BOS-SYD, SYD-LAX, LAX-BOS if the traveler only stopped in SYD and LAX just long enough to change planes.

fields.name: solutions
fields.desc: The number of solutions to return, maximum 500.

schemas.name: FlightInfo
schemas.desc: A flight is a sequence of legs with the same airline carrier and flight number. (A leg is the smallest unit of travel, in the case of a flight a takeoff immediately followed by a landing at two set points on a particular carrier with a particular flight number.) The naive view is that a flight is scheduled travel of an aircraft between two points, with possibly intermediate stops, but carriers will frequently list flights that require a change of aircraft between legs.

fields.name: number
fields.desc: The flight number.

schemas.name: FreeBaggageAllowance
schemas.desc: Information about free baggage allowed on one segment of a trip.

fields.name: bagDescriptor
fields.desc: A representation of a type of bag, such as an ATPCo subcode, Commercial Name, or other description.

fields.name: kilos
fields.desc: The maximum number of kilos all the free baggage together may weigh.

fields.name: kilosPerPiece
fields.desc: The maximum number of kilos any one piece of baggage may weigh.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as free baggage object, allowed on one segment of a trip. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#freeBaggageAllowance.

fields.name: pieces
fields.desc: The number of free pieces of baggage allowed.

fields.name: pounds
fields.desc: The number of pounds of free baggage allowed.

schemas.name: PassengerCounts
schemas.desc: The number and type of passengers. Unfortunately the definition of an infant, child, adult, and senior citizen varies across carriers and reservation systems.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a passenger count object, representing the number of passengers. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#passengerCounts.

fields.name: seniorCount
fields.desc: The number of passengers that are senior citizens.

fields.name: adultCount
fields.desc: The number of passengers that are adults.

fields.name: childCount
fields.desc: The number of passengers that are children.

fields.name: infantInLapCount
fields.desc: The number of passengers that are infants travelling in the lap of an adult.

fields.name: infantInSeatCount
fields.desc: The number of passengers that are infants each assigned a seat.

schemas.name: TaxData
schemas.desc: Tax data.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An identifier uniquely identifying a tax in a response.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a tax data object, representing some tax. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#taxData.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of a tax.

schemas.name: TimeOfDayRange
schemas.desc: Two times in a single day defining a time range.

fields.name: earliestTime
fields.desc: The earliest time of day in HH:MM format.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a time of day range object, representing two times in a single day defining a time range. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#timeOfDayRange.

fields.name: latestTime
fields.desc: The latest time of day in HH:MM format.

schemas.name: LegInfo
schemas.desc: Information about a leg. (A leg is the smallest unit of travel, in the case of a flight a takeoff immediately followed by a landing at two set points on a particular carrier with a particular flight number.)

fields.name: aircraft
fields.desc: The aircraft (or bus, ferry, railcar, etc) travelling between the two points of this leg.

fields.name: arrivalTime
fields.desc: The scheduled time of arrival at the destination of the leg, local to the point of arrival.

fields.name: connectionDuration
fields.desc: Duration of a connection following this leg, in minutes.

fields.name: destinationTerminal
fields.desc: The terminal the flight is scheduled to arrive at.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An identifier that uniquely identifies this leg in the solution.

fields.name: originTerminal
fields.desc: The terminal the flight is scheduled to depart from.

fields.name: duration
fields.desc: The scheduled travelling time from the origin to the destination.

fields.name: meal
fields.desc: A simple, general description of the meal(s) served on the flight, for example: "Hot meal".

fields.name: onTimePerformance
fields.desc: In percent, the published on time performance on this leg.

fields.name: operatingDisclosure
fields.desc: Department of Transportation disclosure information on the actual operator of a flight in a code share. (A code share refers to a marketing agreement between two carriers, where one carrier will list in its schedules (and take bookings for) flights that are actually operated by another carrier.)

fields.name: origin
fields.desc: The leg origin as a city and airport.

fields.name: secure
fields.desc: Whether passenger information must be furnished to the United States Transportation Security Administration (TSA) prior to departure.

fields.name: departureTime
fields.desc: The scheduled departure time of the leg, local to the point of departure.

fields.name: mileage
fields.desc: The number of miles in this leg.

fields.name: changePlane
fields.desc: Whether you have to change planes following this leg. Only applies to the next leg.

fields.name: destination
fields.desc: The leg destination as a city and airport.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a leg object. A leg is the smallest unit of travel, in the case of a flight a takeoff immediately followed by a landing at two set points on a particular carrier with a particular flight number. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#legInfo.

schemas.name: TripOption
schemas.desc: Trip information.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Identifier uniquely identifying this trip in a response.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a trip information object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#tripOption.

fields.name: pricing
fields.desc: Per passenger pricing information.

fields.name: saleTotal
fields.desc: The total price for all passengers on the trip, in the form of a currency followed by an amount, e.g. USD253.35.

fields.name: slice
fields.desc: The slices that make up this trip's itinerary.

schemas.name: TripsSearchResponse
schemas.desc: A QPX Express search response.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a QPX Express API search response resource. Value: the fixed string qpxExpress#tripsSearch.

fields.name: trips
fields.desc: All possible solutions to the QPX Express search request.

schemas.name: AircraftData
schemas.desc: The make, model, and type of an aircraft.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: The aircraft code. For example, for a Boeing 777 the code would be 777.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as an aircraftData object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#aircraftData

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of an aircraft, for example Boeing 777.

schemas.name: AirportData
schemas.desc: An airport.

fields.name: city
fields.desc: The city code an airport is located in. For example, for JFK airport, this is NYC.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: An airport's code. For example, for Boston Logan airport, this is BOS.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as an airport object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#airportData.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of an airport. For example, for airport BOS the name is "Boston Logan International".

schemas.name: CarrierData
schemas.desc: Information about a carrier (ie. an airline, bus line, railroad, etc) that might be useful to display to an end-user.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: The IATA designator of a carrier (airline, etc). For example, for American Airlines, the code is AA.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a kind of carrier (ie. an airline, bus line, railroad, etc). Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#carrierData.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The long, full name of a carrier. For example: American Airlines.

schemas.name: CityData
schemas.desc: Information about a city that might be useful to an end-user; typically the city of an airport.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: The IATA character ID of a city. For example, for Boston this is BOS.

fields.name: country
fields.desc: The two-character country code of the country the city is located in. For example, US for the United States of America.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a city, typically with one or more airports. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#cityData.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The full name of a city. An example would be: New York.

schemas.name: FareInfo
schemas.desc: Complete information about a fare used in the solution to a low-fare search query. In the airline industry a fare is a price an airline charges for one-way travel between two points. A fare typically contains a carrier code, two city codes, a price, and a fare basis. (A fare basis is a one-to-eight character alphanumeric code used to identify a fare.)

fields.name: carrier
fields.desc: The carrier of the aircraft or other vehicle commuting between two points.

fields.name: destination
fields.desc: The city code of the city the trip ends at.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: A unique identifier of the fare.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a fare object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#fareInfo.

fields.name: origin
fields.desc: The city code of the city the trip begins at.

fields.name: private
fields.desc: Whether this is a private fare, for example one offered only to select customers rather than the general public.

schemas.name: TripOptionsResponse
schemas.desc: A QPX Express search response.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: An identifier uniquely identifying this response.

fields.name: tripOption
fields.desc: A list of priced itinerary solutions to the QPX Express query.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: Informational data global to list of solutions.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a QPX Express trip response object, which consists of zero or more solutions. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#tripOptions.

schemas.name: Data
schemas.desc: Detailed information about components found in the solutions of this response, including a trip's airport, city, taxes, airline, and aircraft.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as QPX Express response resource, including a trip's airport, city, taxes, airline, and aircraft. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#data.

fields.name: tax
fields.desc: The taxes due for flying between an origin and a destination.

fields.name: aircraft
fields.desc: The aircraft that is flying between an origin and destination.

fields.name: airport
fields.desc: The airport of an origin or destination.

fields.name: carrier
fields.desc: The airline carrier of the aircraft flying between an origin and destination. Allowed values are IATA carrier codes.

fields.name: city
fields.desc: The city that is either the origin or destination of part of a trip.

schemas.name: PricingInfo
schemas.desc: The price of one or more travel segments. The currency used to purchase tickets is usually determined by the sale/ticketing city or the sale/ticketing country, unless none are specified, in which case it defaults to that of the journey origin country.

fields.name: tax
fields.desc: The taxes used to calculate the tax total per ticket.

fields.name: fare
fields.desc: The fare used to price one or more segments.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a pricing object, representing the price of one or more travel segments. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#pricingInfo.

fields.name: latestTicketingTime
fields.desc: The latest ticketing time for this pricing assuming the reservation occurs at ticketing time and there is no change in fares/rules. The time is local to the point of sale (POS).

fields.name: segmentPricing
fields.desc: The per-segment price and baggage information.

fields.name: refundable
fields.desc: Whether the fares on this pricing are refundable.

fields.name: saleFareTotal
fields.desc: The total fare in the sale or equivalent currency.

fields.name: saleTaxTotal
fields.desc: The taxes in the sale or equivalent currency.

fields.name: saleTotal
fields.desc: Total per-passenger price (fare and tax) in the sale or equivalent currency.

fields.name: baseFareTotal
fields.desc: The total fare in the base fare currency (the currency of the country of origin). This element is only present when the sales currency and the currency of the country of commencement are different.

fields.name: fareCalculation
fields.desc: The horizontal fare calculation. This is a field on a ticket that displays all of the relevant items that go into the calculation of the fare.

fields.name: passengers
fields.desc: The number of passengers to which this price applies.

fields.name: ptc
fields.desc: The passenger type code for this pricing. An alphanumeric code used by a carrier to restrict fares to certain categories of passenger. For instance, a fare might be valid only for senior citizens.

schemas.name: SegmentInfo
schemas.desc: Details of a segment of a flight; a segment is one or more consecutive legs on the same flight. For example a hypothetical flight ZZ001, from DFW to OGG, would have one segment with two legs: DFW to HNL (leg 1), HNL to OGG (leg 2), and DFW to OGG (legs 1 and 2).

fields.name: bookingCode
fields.desc: The booking code or class for this segment.

fields.name: duration
fields.desc: The duration of the flight segment in minutes.

fields.name: flight
fields.desc: The flight this is a segment of.

fields.name: subjectToGovernmentApproval
fields.desc: Whether the operation of this segment remains subject to government approval.

fields.name: bookingCodeCount
fields.desc: The number of seats available in this booking code on this segment.

fields.name: cabin
fields.desc: The cabin booked for this segment.

fields.name: connectionDuration
fields.desc: In minutes, the duration of the connection following this segment.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An id uniquely identifying the segment in the solution.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a segment object. A segment is one or more consecutive legs on the same flight. For example a hypothetical flight ZZ001, from DFW to OGG, could have one segment with two legs: DFW to HNL (leg 1), HNL to OGG (leg 2). Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#segmentInfo.

fields.name: leg
fields.desc: The legs composing this segment.

fields.name: marriedSegmentGroup
fields.desc: The solution-based index of a segment in a married segment group. Married segments can only be booked together. For example, an airline might report a certain booking code as sold out from Boston to Pittsburgh, but as available as part of two married segments Boston to Chicago connecting through Pittsburgh. For example content of this field, consider the round-trip flight ZZ1 PHX-PHL ZZ2 PHL-CLT ZZ3 CLT-PHX. This has three segments, with the two outbound ones (ZZ1 ZZ2) married. In this case, the two outbound segments belong to married segment group 0, and the return segment belongs to married segment group 1.

schemas.name: SegmentPricing
schemas.desc: The price of this segment.

fields.name: freeBaggageOption
fields.desc: Details of the free baggage allowance on this segment.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a segment pricing object, representing the price of this segment. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#segmentPricing.

fields.name: segmentId
fields.desc: Unique identifier in the response of this segment.

fields.name: fareId
fields.desc: A segment identifier unique within a single solution. It is used to refer to different parts of the same solution.

schemas.name: SliceInput
schemas.desc: Criteria a desired slice must satisfy.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a slice input object, representing the criteria a desired slice must satisfy. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#sliceInput.

fields.name: origin
fields.desc: Airport or city IATA designator of the origin.

fields.name: preferredCabin
fields.desc: Prefer solutions that book in this cabin for this slice. Allowed values are COACH, PREMIUM_COACH, BUSINESS, and FIRST.

fields.name: permittedDepartureTime
fields.desc: Slices must depart in this time of day range, local to the point of departure.

fields.name: prohibitedCarrier
fields.desc: A list of 2-letter IATA airline designators. Exclude slices that use these carriers.

fields.name: alliance
fields.desc: Slices with only the carriers in this alliance should be returned; do not use this field with permittedCarrier. Allowed values are ONEWORLD, SKYTEAM, and STAR.

fields.name: date
fields.desc: Departure date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

fields.name: destination
fields.desc: Airport or city IATA designator of the destination.

fields.name: maxConnectionDuration
fields.desc: The longest connection between two legs, in minutes, you are willing to accept.

fields.name: maxStops
fields.desc: The maximum number of stops you are willing to accept in this slice.

fields.name: permittedCarrier
fields.desc: A list of 2-letter IATA airline designators. Slices with only these carriers should be returned.

schemas.name: BagDescriptor
schemas.desc: Information about an item of baggage.

fields.name: commercialName
fields.desc: Provides the commercial name for an optional service.

fields.name: count
fields.desc: How many of this type of bag will be checked on this flight.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: A description of the baggage.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a baggage object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#bagDescriptor.

fields.name: subcode
fields.desc: The standard IATA subcode used to identify this optional service.

schemas.name: SliceInfo
schemas.desc:
Information about a slice. A slice represents a traveller's intent, the portion of a low-fare search corresponding to a traveler's request to get between two points. One-way journeys are generally expressed using 1 slice, round-trips using 2. For example, if a traveler specifies the following trip in a user interface:
| Origin | Destination | Departure Date | | BOS | LAX | March 10, 2007 | | LAX | SYD | March 17, 2007 | | SYD | BOS | March 22, 2007 |
then this is a three slice trip.

fields.name: segment
fields.desc: The segment(s) constituting the slice.

fields.name: duration
fields.desc: The duration of the slice in minutes.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a slice object. A slice represents a traveller's intent, the portion of a low-fare search corresponding to a traveler's request to get between two points. One-way journeys are generally expressed using 1 slice, round-trips using 2. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#sliceInfo.

schemas.name: TaxInfo
schemas.desc: Tax information.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a tax information object. Value: the fixed string qpxexpress#taxInfo.

fields.name: salePrice
fields.desc: The price of the tax in the sales or equivalent currency.

fields.name: chargeType
fields.desc: Whether this is a government charge or a carrier surcharge.

fields.name: code
fields.desc: The code to enter in the ticket's tax box.

fields.name: country
fields.desc: For government charges, the country levying the charge.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Identifier uniquely identifying this tax in a response. Not present for unnamed carrier surcharges.

schemas.name: TripsSearchRequest
schemas.desc: A QPX Express search request.

fields.name: request
fields.desc: A QPX Express search request. Required values are at least one adult or senior passenger, an origin, a destination, and a date.
